title: Law establishing the National Institute of Statistics of Rwanda (NISR) and Determining its Mission, Organisation and Functioning
title_en: Law establishing the National Institute of Statistics of Rwanda (NISR) and Determining its Mission, Organisation and Functioning

provisions.chapter: Chapter One – General provisions
provisions.title: Article One – Purpose of this Law
provisions.content: This Law establishes the National Institute of Statistics of Rwanda abbreviated as “NISR”. It also determines its mission, organization and functioning. NISR shall have legal personality, administrative and financial autonomy and shall be governed in accordance with laws governing public institutions.

provisions.chapter: Chapter One – General provisions
provisions.title: Article 2 – Head office of NISR
provisions.content: The head office of NISR shall be located in Kigali City, the Capital of the Republic of Rwanda. It may be transferred elsewhere on the Rwandan territory if deemed necessary. NISR may have branches elsewhere in the country if deemed necessary in order to fulfill its mission upon approval by a Prime Minister’s Order.

provisions.chapter: Chapter II – Mission of NISR
provisions.title: Article 3 – Mission of NISR
provisions.content: The main mission of NISR shall be as follows: 1° to define and ensure the respect of standards and methodologies applied by the national statistical system; 2° to conduct national census and other national surveys; 3° to advise and train the personnel in charge of national statistical activities in the country; 4° to coordinate and gather statistical information and methodologies of different sectorial departments in charge of statistical activities in the country; 5° to disseminate the official statistical data whether the one publicized by the Institute or the data bearing its visa; 6° to coordinate activities of the national statistical system; 7° to advise State institutions regarding the development of the national statistical system; 8° to encourage the public to participate in statistical activities and learn how to use the census and surveys results; 9° to prepare the national program of the statistical system; 10° to advise Government on the establishment of policies and strategies related to the promotion of the statistical system; 11° to accomplish any other function relating to the statistics as may be assigned by State Administration.

provisions.chapter: Chapter III – Supervising authority of NISR and its category
provisions.title: Article 4 – Supervising authority of NISR and its category
provisions.content: A Prime Minister’s Order shall determine the supervising authority of NISR and its category. There shall be concluded between the supervising authority of NISR and the decision-making organ a performance contract indicating competences, rights and obligations of each party in order for NISR to fulfill its mission. Such a contract shall be valid for a period equal to the term of office of the members of the decision-making organ of NISR.

provisions.chapter: Chapter IV – Organisation and functions of NISR
provisions.title: Article 5 – Management organs of NISR
provisions.content: NISR shall have the following two (2) management organs: 1° the Board of Directors; 2° the General Directorate. A Prime Minister’s Order may determine other relevant organs in order for NISR to fulfill its mission.

provisions.chapter: Chapter IV – Organisation and functions of NISR
provisions.title: Article 6 – Board of Directors of NISR
provisions.content: The Board of Directors of NISR shall be the governing and decision-making organ. Its competences, responsibilities and functioning as well as the responsibilities and the term of office of its members shall be determined by a Prime Minister’s Order. A Presidential Order shall appoint members of the Board of Directors including the Chairperson and the Deputy Chairperson. Members of the Board of Directors shall be selected on the basis of their competence and expertise. At least thirty per cent (30%) of the members of the Board of Directors must be females.

provisions.chapter: Chapter IV – Organisation and functions of NISR
provisions.title: Article 7 – Sitting allowances for members of the Board of Directors
provisions.content: Members of the Board of Directors present in the meetings of the Board of Directors shall be entitled to sitting allowances determined by a Presidential Order.

provisions.chapter: Chapter IV – Organisation and functions of NISR
provisions.title: Article 8 – Incompatibilities with the membership of the Board of Directors of NISR
provisions.content: Members of the Board of Directors shall not be allowed to perform any remunerated activity within NISR. They shall also not be allowed, either individually or companies in which they hold shares, to bid for tenders of NISR.

provisions.chapter: Chapter IV – Organisation and functions of NISR
provisions.title: Article 9 – Members of NISR General Directorate
provisions.content: Members of the General Directorate of NISR shall be appointed by a Presidential Order. The competences and responsibilities of members of the General Directorate of NISR shall be determined by a Prime Minister’s Order.

provisions.chapter: Chapter IV – Organisation and functions of NISR
provisions.title: Article 10 – Statute governing staff of NISR and benefits of members of the General Directorate and the staff of NISR
provisions.content: The staff of NISR shall be governed by the general statute for Rwanda Public Service. Benefits allocated to members of the General Directorate and to the staff of NISR shall be determined in accordance with legal provisions governing benefits to employees of public institutions.

provisions.chapter: Chapter IV – Organisation and functions of NISR
provisions.title: Article 11 – Organization, functioning and responsibilities of the organs of NISR
provisions.content: The organization, functioning and responsibilities of the organs of NISR shall be determined by a Prime Minister’s Order.

provisions.chapter: Chapter V – Property and finance
provisions.title: Article 12 – Property of NISR and its sources
provisions.content: The property of NISR shall be comprised of movables and immovables. It shall come from the following sources: 1° State budget allocations; 2° State or partners’ subsidies; 3° income from services rendered; 4° donations and bequests.

provisions.chapter: Chapter V – Property and finance
provisions.title: Article 13 – Use, management and audit of the property of NISR
provisions.content: The use, management and audit of the property of NISR shall be carried out in accordance with relevant legal provisions. NISR internal audit unit shall submit a report to the Board of Directors with a copy to the head of the General Directorate of NISR.

provisions.chapter: Chapter V – Property and finance
provisions.title: Article 14 – Approval and management of the budget of NISR
provisions.content: The budget of NISR shall be approved and managed in accordance with relevant legal provisions.

provisions.chapter: Chapter V – Property and finance
provisions.title: Article 15 – Annual financial report
provisions.content: Within three (3) months following the closure of the financial year, the head of the General Directorate of NISR shall submit to the supervising authority of NISR the annual financial report after approval by the Board of Directors in accordance with laws governing the management of State finance and property.

provisions.chapter: Chapter VI – Miscellaneous and final provisions
provisions.title: Article 16 – Transfer of agreements, activities and property of INSR
provisions.content: Agreements and activities of INSR which were performed before the publication of this Law in the Official Gazette of the Republic of Rwanda shall remain valid. Movable and immovable property, liabilities and the name of INSR are hereby transferred to NISR established by this Law.

provisions.chapter: Chapter VI – Miscellaneous and final provisions
provisions.title: Article 17 – INSR former staff members
provisions.content: INSR staff members who fulfill the requirements during the recruitment shall be transferred to NISR in accordance with relevant legal provisions.

provisions.chapter: Chapter VI – Miscellaneous and final provisions
provisions.title: Article 18 – Drafting, consideration and adoption of this Law
provisions.content: This Law was drafted in English, considered and adopted in Kinyarwanda.

provisions.chapter: Chapter VI – Miscellaneous and final provisions
provisions.title: Article 19 – Repealing provision
provisions.content: Law n° 09/2005 of 14/07/2005 establishing the National Institute of Statistics of Rwanda and all prior legal provisions contrary to this Law, are hereby repealed.

provisions.chapter: Chapter VI – Miscellaneous and final provisions
provisions.title: Article 20 – Commencement
provisions.content: This Law shall come into force on the date of its publication in the Official Gazette of the Republic of Rwanda.
